Key Match Events: Lucas Erceg allowed two inherited runners to score and gave up a run during the Guardians' four-run seventh inning
Post-Match Reflections: The Royals would have liked a sweep, but they're leaving Cleveland just one game behind the Guardians for the American League Central lead with 29 games left.

Every time we play a series, we want to win the series. That was a good step forward for us to win it. When you get the first three, you want to win the fourth. It’s disappointing today, but by no means should that put a damper on what these guys accomplished. And it’s a race. We’re going to [go] back and forth.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Kansas City starters covered just 10 1/3 innings over those first three games, leaving relievers to pick up 16 1/3 innings
Wacha was at 91 pitches entering the seventh, so Quatraro sent the starter back to the mound.
Quatraro wanted to stay away from Daniel Lynch IV, a traditional starter who threw 34 pitches in three scoreless innings on Monday.
Similarly, he didn’t want to use Kris Bubic, who pitched on back-to-back days Sunday and Monday and is in his first year post-Tommy John surgery.
